snippet: The death of Amar Diarrassouba, 6, has provided a window into how elected officials and pedestrian safety advocates in New York City navigate the complex politics of a tragedy.
abstract: Death of first-grader Amar Diarrassouba provides window into how elected officials and pedestrian safety advocates in New York City navigate complex politics of a tragedy; New Yorkers identify many possible villains--truck driver churning through residential neighborhood, school crossing guard who was not at her post and Police Department that does not enforce traffic laws as stringently as it might.
lead_paragraph: The death of Amar Diarrassouba, 6, has provided a window into how elected officials and pedestrian safety advocates in New York City navigate the complex politics of a tragedy.

headline.seo: Assigning Blame After Boy Is Killed by Truck
headline.main: Fingers Are Pointed After Truck Kills Boy
headline.print_headline: Fingers Are Pointed After Truck Kills Boy
